text: I'm not kidding when I say these are the best socks I've ever bought. I'm talking about the grey heather size 6-12 ankle socks. Unfortunately, Amazon hasn't had these in stock for quite some time (or maybe they sell out right away?). Only the larger size, which I can't comment on. But for this size, it fits my feet perfectly (I wear size 10-10.5 shoes). Other socks in this size range are a little tight on my feet, but these go right on. The thickness is just right, they don't feel too thick but they aren't thin either. I don't get any stretching of the sock where your foot starts to show through the thin material, like you see in some socks.I've been using these pretty much every day for a year and a half, and in all 10 pairs I don't have any holes or fraying or anything like that. I wish I bought more than 10 pairs at the time because I've tried other socks since then (not to replace these, but to expand my wardrobe) and honestly, none have been as good as these. I don't know if the quality is the same across Amazon's other color choices, but I like the solid grey ankle socks so I'm out of luck unless these come back.

text: Three pairs of socks with a nicely cushioned bottom of the foot and a rather thin top of the foot.  These are great for everyday walking around, but just didn't feel cushioned enough overall for distance hiking.  They did fit into shoes of the normal size without making them feel too tight.The socks are about 9" long from the floor to the top of the cuff, the ribbed leg is about 7" long, and the foot measures about 9" long but stretches a lot to fit extremely well. When worn there are no wrinkles or bunching and the toe seam is very smooth.Each of the three pairs has a different accent stripe color which looks nice but I wish they were all the same color to allow a cohesive look when they start to wear out and I need to mix the pairs.  The colored heel stripe will show when wearing a lower boot or shoe.Fiber content is 60% polyester, 31% cotton, 6% nylon, and 3% elastane.  With that fiber content they should wear very well.I tossed them in a regular wash load (warm temp, normal clean) and then into the dryer on a normal cycle and they came out fine.  My photo with one sock going one way and the other sock going the other way was taken after being washed.  The washing instructions recommend a more cautious washing: Machine wash cold, wash with like colors, use gentle cycle, only non-chlorine belach when needed. Tumble dry low.  Do not iron.  Do not dry clean.

text: These Amazon Essentials socks are high quality although their efforts on packaging are minimalist at best. I would agree with the listing calling these a crew sock as they come up the leg as I would expect from a crew sock. I selected the Regular size which fits me well, normally I wear a 11.5 shoe. text: Hello everyone,When it comes to my feet, I chose comfort over looks, however with this set, I don’t have to compromise. Wearing them for almost 2 weeks now, I have found that #1they do a great job at keeping my legs warm especially when I wear skirts or nightgowns and #2they washed well. That said, these are on the thin side. When I wore them during chilly days, they were a bit slippery inside the shoes. My legs felt warmer, but my feet and toes were cold. Also, the stretchy band at the top felt tight, almost like compression socks. It doesn’t bother me as much, but it’s worth mentioning! In a nutshell, I like the warmth and comfort these provide as they cover my entire legs as opposed to crew socks, but perhaps the thickness would be more suitable for warmer weather.Thank you!

text: I was expecting something a bit thicker than these are. I would describe these more like trouser socks, even if they're cotton and not nylon. They are thin and comfortable, but there's no padding of any kind under or around the foot. They are *knee-high*, but I'm 5'3" and they are a bit too high covering the lower half of my knee. They'd be comfortable as a summer weight sock to wear with office attire. Warm enough to keep you comfortable in an air-conditioned office, but definitely not heavy enough for winter use. The scalloped edging at the top is really cute and makes these look more feminine, but when you put them on it all but disappears, so I'm not sure what the point of that was. These are nice knee-highs if you need something breathable and lightweight. I'm not convinced the elastic will stand up because they feel like they'd be easily stretched out, but only time will tell. Overall, not the best, not the worst, depending on what you're looking for. At the current price of around $4.50/pair, they're a decent value for money. One last note on these - if you have pets, EVERYTHING sticks to these - pet hair, lint, dust, etc. The standard wool blend socks I wear every day don't attract anywhere near as much stuff as these do, so that represented a major downside for me.
title: More Like a Trouser Sock.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2023

text: This is a review of “Amazon Essentials Women's Casual Cotton Rib Scallop Top Knee High Socks, 4 Pairs, Black, 6-9[As a vine reviewer, I am pledging not to be compensated or influenced by the vendor;  I state my opinions based on my personal experience without any bias or pressure]This is a set of four pairs of women’s cotton knee high socks (8 socks on total). It’s predominantly made out of cotton in Pakistan and has sufficient nylon content to keep the socks fairly stretchable. The size that we ordered was for women’s sizes 6 to 9 , and our daughter (size 8 )was able to wear it very comfortably. The socks sem to have reasonably good strength in the elastic, and we were able to wash it without any perceptible loss of color. I do urge you to wash it in a light setting to prevent the fabrics from being stretched and getting a bit torn in the process. All in all the price seems to be in a reasonable range and the quality is quite acceptable. The one thing that our daughter also did like was at the top of the socks there is a nice design (a bit like a ruffled type). On balance, a commodity product like this is very difficult to distinguish from other competitors, but given that this is an Amazon essentials brand, the quality being quite acceptable, we give it four stars.
title: An Amazon Essentials pack of women’s knee high socks - high on quality and usability
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2023

text: Was looking for an ankle sock for the summer months. Hoping they'll last a while and intended to order a size up. Reading the sizing guide, I wanted 4T-5T. 4T-5T wasn't an option but 3-4T was....so I went with that. Socks arrived and packaging said "4T-5T"....so that's good news for me but probably disappointing for someone else. Unfortunately they're sized much smaller. Visually, they are similar to a Hanes 2T-3T sock in size (see picture). That said they have a lot of more stretch possible than a Hanes sock does so they will probably last a bit longer than the Hanes will. They fit my son perfectly right now. He is in toddler size 9 shoes. 6.25" from heel to big toe. Medium thickness socks....thicker than Hanes. Good for the California winters that we have but probably something thicker would be better for actual winters. They're soft. And seem breathable. Overall they seem good....just annoyed with the sizing since I was trying to intentionally buy the next size up not get more of his current size.
